p.s: Buying exotic pets can be tricky .
The price , location , and the type are all very important .
That is why it is necessary to observe all of the factors in buying an exotic pet .
Here are some tips that will guide you into buying exotic pets the right way !

item.s: First , you must of course choose a kind of exotic pet to buy .
This can be your favorite animal , or maybe just an animal that you think is interesting .
Once you have your type of animal picked out , research them and make sure you know what they are like and how to take care of one .
Make sure you are very up-to-date with feeding , housing , and loving them .
Find a store or person that sells the type of animal that you want .
Make sure to go to a place that has a good reputation and is n't sketchy .
And if you do buy an animal from a questionable seller , then be prepared for sick and/or injured animals .
Make sure to watch their health closely if you choose to buy from them .
Check with your state laws to make sure that the animal you want is n't illegal to own as a civilian .
For exotic pets , prices can easily add up to a big sum .
Make sure that the animal you want fits into your budget .
Do n't buy an expensive animal knowing that you do n't have the money to take care of it properly .
Your animal will suffer because of you , and you wo n't be happy with your purchase .
Buying an exotic pet is a little risky when it comes to location .
You could be buying an animal from within your city , or you could be travelling the world .
It all depends on how rare/endangered they are .
Make sure you have plans for getting them safely to your home .
It is very important to understand your exotic pet 's needs .
Make sure you have the time and money to take care of them .
This is why it is important for you to research your animal before you actually get them .
Every exotic pet is unique in their own way .
They are n't like taking care of a cat or dog .
They are much more high maintenance .
It is a good idea to have your animal 's habitat already set up before they arrive at home .
This way , it will save you the time and hassle later .
Never , ever , ever buy an animal , regardless of the type , ( yes , even insects/amphibians/reptiles ! ) off of the internet .
Craigslist , Ebay , Amazon , etc. are all examples .
Often , the seller will lie to you about the animal 's breed , health , age , gender , etc.
